title: IB Program Implementation Strategies in the Era of Globalization: Project-Based Learning Through Asian Case Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational knowledge of educational policy, general understanding of international education programs (IB), and concepts of qualitative research methodologies
context.additional_context: Students must collect research data and utilize collaboration tools in a smartphone-centric, limited-technology environment. Focus on developing IB program implementation strategies applicable to field settings.

learning_goals: Ability to analyze how core elements of the IB program (curriculum design, language policy, fostering global citizenship) are integrated into local educational contexts
Ability to comparatively evaluate IB implementation strategies based on qualitative case studies from Asian regions (Taiwan, Hong Kong, Singapore)
Ability to write actionable reports proposing internationalization strategies for local educational institutions through project-based learning

resources: Access to Academic Paper Database on Educational Policy
Smartphone-Compatible Collaboration Tools (Google Docs, Padlet, etc.)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
